p.value: Materials are open to researchers. Please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.
Donated by Ronald Vance in May 2016. The accession number associated with this gift is 2016.023.
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

Ronald Vance is an artist and writer active during the 1960s through the 1980s. He was born in Connecticut and graduated from Yale University before lecturing on the history of art at Leicester College of Art and then moving to Italy. As of May 2016, he was living in Long Island and was retired.

abstract.value: Ronald Vance is an artist and writer active in the United States and Europe during the later half of the 20th century. This collection consists of correspondence, as well as published and unpublished writings by Vance from the late 1960s through the mid 1980s. Works of fiction present in the collection were published in literary journals including Sun and Moon, Not Guilty Magazine, and Interstate Magazine. The collection also includes unpublished writings, including notes and drafts related to Vance's I Went to Italy and Ate Chocolate.

p.value:
Published citations should take the following form:

Identification of item, date; Ronald Vance Papers; MSS 454; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.

At the time of accessioning, materials were rehoused in an acid-free box. Some folders were replaced when they were noticeably damaged, but the majority of the folders in the collection are original to the donor. The original folder order, as well as folder titles has been retained. No arrangement or other physical interventions have taken place.

This collection consists of correspondence, as well as published and unpublished writings by Ronald Vance from the late 1960s through the mid 1980s. Works of fiction present in the collection were published in literary journals including Sun and Moon, Not Guilty Magazine, and Interstate Magazine. The collection also includes unpublished writings, including notes and drafts related to Vance's I Went to Italy and Ate Chocolate.

Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Ronald Vance, were transferred to New York University in 2016 by Ronald Vance. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from the Fales Library and Special Collections. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.
